org.apache.derbyTesting.junit

Interface Connector

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConnectionPoolDataSourceConnector, DataSourceConnector, DriverManagerConnector, XADataSourceConnector

    interface Connector
    Factory for getting connections within the tests that is designed for the simple working case for most tests. Most tests just need to connect or shutdown the database, this hides through BaseJDBCTestCase and TestConfiguration the details of how those operations are performed.

    Tests that need finer control over the connection handling should use the JDBC classes directly, such as DriverManager or DataSource.

    This is split out into an interface and sub-classes to ensure that no ClassNotFoundExceptions are thrown when running in an JSR 169 environment and DriverManager is not available.

      • shutDatabase

        void shutDatabase()
           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Shutdown the running default database using user and password defined by the configuration passed to setConfiguration. Return nothing, exception is expected to be thrown with SQLState 08006
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • shutEngine

        void shutEngine(boolean deregisterDriver)
         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Shutdown the running derby engine (not the network server). This method can only be called when the engine is running embedded in this JVM. Return nothing, exception is expected to be thrown with SQLState XJ015
        Parameters:
        deregisterDriver - if true, deregister driver
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • setLoginTimeout

        void setLoginTimeout(int seconds)
              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Set the login timeout for getting connections. Timeout is measured in seconds.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
